humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that 'Number of lymph nodes with macrometastases (>0.2 cm): 2.' This indicates that the patient has metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, which corresponds to the N1 stage according to the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's pathology report indicates that there are metastatic carcinoma deposits in two of eighteen lymph nodes (Metastatic carcinoma in two of eighteen lymph nodes). This corresponds to pN1a (Regional lymph nodes (pN): pN1a: Metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, at least 1 metastasis greater than 2.0 mm). Therefore, the N stage is N1.
